description: Installation of digital media screen (Advertisement Consent)
decision_conditions: 7. The LED unit hereby permitted shall not display any moving or apparently moving images or animation.  Reason: In the interest of public safety in accordance with sections 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 (f) of the Ealing's Development | 8. The advertisements displayed on the LED screen hereby permitted shall not change more than once every 60 seconds and any change between advertisements shall take less than one second to complete.  Reason: In the interest of public safety in accordance with sections 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 (f) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the Ealing's Development Management - Development Plan Document (2013). | 9. The LED unit hereby permitted shall be fitted with a mechanism that ensures the screen defaults to an output level no higher than that which has been conditioned to be the acceptable maximum under normal operation. The mechanism shall be installed prior to the first operation of the LED unit hereby permitted and thereafter retained, operated and maintained in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. If this cannot be achieved, then the display should be required to default to an "off" position until the problem can be resolved.   Reason: In the interest of the visual amenity of the area as a whole and public safety in accordance with sections 1, 4, 7 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 2.8, 6.1 and 6.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.17 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 (f) (g) (h) (i) (k), 1.2 (f) and 3.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policies 2.8, 7.4, 7A and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management - Development Plan Document (2013). | 10. The digital media screen hereby approved shall be fitted with the specified light sensors which shall control the brightness at all times. During the daytime period (between local sunrise and sunset) the brightness of the screens shall be controlled to be no more than 3500 Nitts/sqm. During the nighttime period (sunset and sunrise) the brightness shall be controlled to be no more than 350 Nitts/sqm  Reason: In the interest of the visual amenity of the area as a whole and public safety in accordance with sections 1, 4, 7 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 2.8, 6.1 and 6.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 and 7.17 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1 (f) (g) (h) (i) (k), 1.2 (f) and 3.1 (c) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policies 2.8, 7.4, 7A and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management - Development Plan Document (2013).
